means: 使工业化(industrialize的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The G-7 organization groups together the world's seven leading industrialized nations.
sentence.Network_cn: 七国集团将世界上7个最主要的工业国家归在一起。

sentence.Network_en: Stalin's methods had industrialized the Russian economy.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯大林采取的措施使俄国经济实现了工业化。

sentence.Network_en: The governments of the industrialized world had failed to get the measure of the crisis.
sentence.Network_cn: 工业化国家的政府没能意识到这次危机的严重程度。

entry.def: An industrialized area or place is one which has a lot of industries.

example.ex: Industrialized countries must reduce carbon dioxide emissions.
example.tran: 工业化国家必须减少二氧化碳的排放。

auth_sentence.content: A highly industrialized, materialistic society like Britain.

auth_sentence.content: Japan has floated the idea of an emergency summit of the G7 industrialized countries.
auth_sentence.res_content: Japan has floated the idea of an emergency summit of the G7 industrialized countries.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Japan has floated the idea of an emergency summit of the G7 industrialized countries.

auth_sentence.content: Recovery cannot depend solely on climbing demand in industrialized nations for foreign goods, Mr. Supachai told the meeting.
